info.title: Recommendation
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 680 - Customer 

Recommendation API is used to recommend offering quickly based on the history and real-time context of customer. It is a real-time and personalized recommendation API.

get.description: This operation list or find QueryProductRecommendation entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Result-Count.description: Actual number of items returned in the response body

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

post.description: This operation creates a QueryProductRecommendation entity.

get.description: This operation retrieves a QueryProductRecommendation entity. Attribute selection is enabled for all first level attributes.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to provide in response

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

post.description: Example of a client listener for receiving the notification QueryProductRecommendationCreateEvent
Example of a client listener for receiving the notification QueryProductRecommendationStateChangeEvent

AgreementItemRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

Money.description: A base / value business entity used to represent money

unit.description: Currency (ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency)

Place.description: Place reference. Place defines the places where the products are sold or delivered.

id.description: Unique identifier of the place

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

Price.description: Provides all amounts (tax included, duty free, tax rate), used currency and percentage to apply for Price Alteration.

dutyFreeAmount.description: All taxes excluded amount (expressed in the given currency)

taxIncludedAmount.description: All taxes included amount (expressed in the given currency)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

PriceAlteration.description: Is an amount, usually of money, that modifies the price charged for an order item.

applicationDuration.description: Duration during which the alteration applies on the order item price (for instance 2 months free of charge for the recurring charge)

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this order item price alteration

name.description: Name of the order item price alteration

priceType.description: A category that describes the price such as recurring, one time and usage.

priority.description: Priority level for applying this alteration among all the defined alterations on the order item price

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

Product.description: A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).

id.description: Unique identifier of the product

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

ProductPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that represents the actual price paid by a Customer for a purchase, a rent or a lease of a Product. The price is valid for a defined period of time.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this product price.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price".

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

ProductRefOrValue.description: A product to be created defined by value or existing defined by reference. The polymorphic attributes @type, @schemaLocation & @referredType are related to the product entity and not the RelatedProductRefOrValue class itself

id.description: Unique identifier of the product

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

ProductRelationship.description: Linked products to the one instantiate, such as [bundled] if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled products inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

relationshipType.description: Type of the product relationship, such as [bundled] if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the bundled products inside this bundle; [reliesOn] if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product) [targets] or [isTargeted] (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

ProductSpecificationRef.description: Product specification reference: A ProductSpecification is a detailed description of a tangible or intangible object made available externally in the form of a ProductOffering to customers or other parties playing a party role.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

targetProductSchema.description: A target product schema reference. The reference object to the schema and type of target product which is described by product specification.

Quantity.description: An amount in a given unit

amount.description: Numeric value in a given unit

QueryProductRecommendation.description: Recommendation API is used to recommend offering quickly based on the history and real-time context of customer. It is a real-time and personalized recommendation API. It is usually provided by e-commerce or BSS, CRM system in omni-channel.

id.description: Unique identifier of the queryProductRecommendation

instantSyncRecommendation.description: An indicator which when the value is "true" means that requester expects to get recommendation result in the response

place.description: The place which the queryProductRecommendation is related to

state.description: State of the queryProductRecommendation defined in the state engine

validFor.description: The period in which the queryProductRecommendation is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name
